zone.line: tween us, but the next day he again
stopped at my cottage and by degrees an
intimacy grew between us. It was l strange
to him to see a female in the first
bloom of youth, I was not yet twenty,
evidently belonging to the first classes
of society & possessing every accomplish-
ment an excellent education could
bestow, living alone on a desolate
health – One on whose forehead the
impress of grief was strongly marked, and
whose words and motions betrayed that
her thoughts did not follow them but
were intent on on far other ideas;
bitter and overwhelming miseries. b I was
dressed also in a whimsical manner –
black silk covered me in nunlike
dres which denoted that I did not retire
to solitude from necessity, but that I
might indulge in a luxury of grief, and
fanciful seclusion.
extreme
habit
